column5: We will spend each class working on dramatic exercises and games to strengthen those acting skills and build confidence. This class is all about gaining confidence in character building, the ins and outs of theater and how staging works. There will be no large productions or performances outside of our club time.

n this yoga class geared toward the unique needs of middle schoolers, students will learn, not only balance, strength, and flexibility but also mind-body connection, self-awareness, and how to build a practice of self-care in a way that is enjoyable and long-lasting. Classes include yoga-based games, challenges, breathing exercises, meditations, and activities designed to promote a strong sense of community. A yoga mat will be provided, but students are welcome to bring their own if they prefer.
Join Coach Rod for an afternoon club where you will be sure to get your sweat on! He will cover proper technique for stretching and calisthenics, with a little running and some fun fitness games too.

Spanish Book Club is designed for students who are interested in learning the Spanish language through literature. We'll read and discuss books written for Spanish language learners and explore the corresponding culture through food, music, and art, in a supportive and inclusive environment. Our goal is to build confidence and improve language skills while discovering new stories and perspectives. Whether you're just starting out or want to brush up on your Spanish, come immerse yourself in the rich history and vibrant culture of Spanish-speaking countries.

Knitting Club is designed for students who want to experience the benefits of a calming and soothing hobby that also allows them to create something unique, useful, and beautiful. Beginners will receive expert guidance and support, while those with more experience can work on refining their skills. We'll explore new techniques and share our progress in a fun and friendly setting. Students are asked to bring their own yarn and needles (suggestions available for those just starting out.) Knitters of all skill levels are welcome!

Open Art Studio provides time and space for students to work on projects with a variety of materials and an art teacher present to provide guidance, inspiration, and instruction. Students can work on the recommended project or work on something of their own.

Students teams, led by Dungeon Masters gather to play weekly with Mr. Tim available to supervise and provide necessary materials, tips, and support. Email Mr. Tim if your student is interested in being a Dungeon Master.
